content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle with some natural quirks that make it a bit hard (like having backwards paths and objects that aren't in the path between Luffy and the Sunny).

Also, One Piece is Peak Fiction, so of course this is a great clash! :)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a good puzzle that can be solved quickly and whose features are revealed as you go along. Well suited to the Clash format.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Perfectly solvable within 5 minutes, while requiring just a bit more than one simple line of code. Nice build-up of cases, with first L and S at start and end, then not, and finally L and S reversed. In this also tests and validators are balanced.

Some minor language remarks (not harming the clash, so I could already approve):
- 'Luffy *wants* to (...) and he *wants* to know how much time *it will take him* to reach there.'
- 'A string path is given that *shows* Luffy's position (...)'
Output
- 'An integer that *shows* the (...)'

And, for constraints you could also say '3 â‰¤ length of path â‰¤ 100', to not let people worry about the possibility of encountering "LS" and what the output should be then.

Hello, it's a very nice puzzle, well fitted for Clash format !

I suggest adding one more simple example to make it clear that L is not always before S, and that there can be characters around both L and S.

Perhaps: "_S___L__" => "3"

That should be a better exo is that was a double dimension, so people would exercice on Dijkstra. Or add more difficulty like, luffy use a special ability that can attack two consecutive bandit for example :
LBBS => LBS => 3 minutes

Hi and thanks @Immortal_Emperor for your Contribution ðŸ‘:
-> I like your idea ðŸ’¡,
-> I appreciate you added a TestCase where S < L ðŸ˜‰,
-> why not add the "Size Mode" ðŸ’¬?
-> maybe some TestCases like "L_B___S" / "L_^___S" and "L_R___S" could enable "Reverse Mode" too (if paired with corresponding Validators) ðŸ¤”?
ðŸ‘‰ Will you ðŸ™?

Goal
* Please change "{{path}} also" to "[[path]] also".

* Please add the key to {{E}}, which appears in the path in some cases but not explained here.

Output
* Please change "Line 2" to "Line 1".

Constraints
* Please change "[[path]]" to "length of [[path]]".

Cases
* "Restaurant In Mountains" (test): Please add some Bandits to the path so that the test is more similar to the validator.

* "Finally Stopped" (validator): Please add some Es to the path so that the validator is more similar to the test.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer").

Thanks.

* Please change "{{path}} also" to "[[path]] also".
=> Done

* Please add the key to {{E}}, which appears in the path in some cases but not explained here.
=> E's were a typo error and I removed them 

Output
* Please change "Line 2" to "Line 1".
=> Done

Constraints
* Please change "[[path]]" to "length of [[path]]".
=>Done

Cases
* "Restaurant In Mountains" (test): Please add some Bandits to the path so that the test is more similar to the validator.
=>Done


* "Finally Stopped" (validator): Please add some Es to the path so that the validator is more similar to the test.
=> E's removed 

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer").
=>Done

Thanks for your suggestion's

I will enable Size Mode but I think Reverse Mode will not be suitable for this one. I will try to create another clash of code similar to this for Reverse Mode.

@Jp82 and thanks for you feedback.

That's a nice addition but I want this to be solvable under 15 minutes, adding special abilities would make it more complex but I liked your idea adding special abilities would be great for a PUZZLE.   ;)
@jddingemanse fixed the grammar errors, not a native speaker so... but anyways thanks for your feedback.
